frame.name: Frequency
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame has to do with the repetition (and especially the frequency of repetition) of an event. Many of the adjectives and adverbs in this frame are based on nouns in the Calendric_unit frame.
<ex>China will have to face a <fex name="Degree">high</fex> <t>frequency</t> <fex name="Event">of sand storms</fex> in the years to come.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for any (bounded) <fen>Event</fen> whose frequency or iteration is described. <ex>The country has been struck by <t>frequent</t> <fex name="Event">economic crises</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Event">The symptoms</fex> were <t>sporadic</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the actually observed rate of occurrence of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> differs from the expected rate.
<ex>The Crested Lark (Galerida cristata) is <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>frequent</t> from the coastal plain to the mountains.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Interval
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Interval</fen> is a noun modified by the target word. The target word specifies the frequency of the <fen>Interval</fen> . <ex>The meetings occurred at <t>fortnightly</t> <fex name="Interval">intervals</fex>.</ex> <ex>The parties were held on a <t>monthly</t> <fex name="Interval">basis</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_span
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time_span</fen> is the length of time of the <fen>Interval</fen>. This FE is incorporated by most of the lexical units in this frame.
<ex>You have to renew the license <t>every</t> <fex name="Time_span">year</fex> .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times per unit of real or scanning time that an <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is encountered.
<ex>The state government spends its fiscal year 2006 budget of $23.4 billion at a <t>rate</t> <fex name="rat">of $742 per second</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Salient_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity which the implicit cognizer encounters with the specified frequency.
<ex>It costs about US$2.50 to travel 200km (124 mi), but <fex name="sal">buses</fex> are <t>infrequent</t> and only one or two buses a day service most routes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition:
<def-root>The frequency feature of the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is under discussion. All the lexical units in this frame incorporate this frame element.
<ex>These exposures were likely to be <t>intermittent</t> <fex name="att">in frequency</fex> occurring only when workers were participating in activities at these specific areas.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The Time when the Event has a particular frequency.</def-root>

FE.name: Group
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Group</fen> in which the <fen>Event</fen> or <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is frequent. <ex><fex name="Salient_entity">Obesity</fex> is <t>common</t> <fex name="Group">to Americans</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Salient_entity">Obesity</fex> is <t>common</t> <fex name="Group">in America</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Salient_entity">Behaviors</fex> <t>common</t> <fex name="Group">to small children</fex> include crying.</ex></def-root >
